meanings.definition: To rid of Nazi influence or ideology.
meanings.sent1: The country worked to denazify its government after the war.
meanings.sent2: It is important to denazify historical records for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The librarian decided to denazify the book collection by removing any propaganda.
meanings.sent4: She aimed to denazify her thoughts and embrace tolerance.
meanings.sent5: The mission was to denazify the community and promote unity.

meanings.sent1: The museum had to denazify the artifacts before displaying them.
meanings.sent2: Efforts were made to denazify the school curriculum.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to denazify the recipe by changing the ingredients.
meanings.sent4: He wanted to denazify his wardrobe by getting rid of any symbols.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to denazify the building and make it welcoming to all.

meanings.definition: The process of removing Nazi influence or ideology.
meanings.sent1: Denazify is a crucial step in rebuilding a society after conflict.
meanings.sent2: The denazify of the organization was a long and challenging process.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show portrayed a humorous denazify of a fictional town.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work symbolized the denazify of hate with love and unity.
meanings.sent5: The denazify of the community brought hope and reconciliation to its members.
